item.title: Blog Post
item.description: Python Code along with R-Code The first code chunk is that of python. I loaded the "quakes" dataset Communication of R code with Python The second and third code chunk is that of python and R-strudio communicating with each other. I found the mean of magnitude in the quakes data set which is 4.6204000000000001 quakes<- quakes r.quakes.mag.mean() ## 4.6204000000000001

item.title: Project 1
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: #0.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
